questions.question: What pandas method performs SQL-like window functions?
questions.explanation: Rolling applies functions over sliding windows.

questions.question: What NumPy function performs Einstein summation?
questions.explanation: Einsum evaluates multidimensional array operations efficiently.

questions.question: What scikit-learn class creates preprocessing pipelines?
questions.explanation: Pipeline chains transformers and estimators sequentially.

questions.question: What pandas accessor handles time series data?
questions.explanation: The dt accessor provides datetime properties and methods.

questions.question: What NumPy function broadcasts arrays for operations?
questions.explanation: Broadcast_to expands arrays to compatible shapes.

questions.question: What pandas method optimizes memory with categorical data?
questions.explanation: Astype converts columns to memory-efficient categorical dtype.

questions.question: What scikit-learn function performs stratified sampling?
questions.explanation: StratifiedShuffleSplit maintains class proportions in splits.

questions.question: What pandas method evaluates expressions efficiently?
questions.explanation: Eval computes DataFrame expressions with improved performance.

questions.question: What NumPy module handles masked arrays?
questions.explanation: The ma module handles arrays with missing or invalid data.

questions.question: What scikit-learn transformer standardizes features?
questions.explanation: StandardScaler removes mean and scales to unit variance.
